name: Interesting American History Online Quiz | U.S. History | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which individual did NOT sign the Constitution?
questions.explanation:
John Adams.

	People speak about the signers of the Declaration of Independence, but never discuss who signed the Constitution.

questions.text: Who is credited as being the discoverer of the Mississippi River?

questions.explanation:
John Pershing.

	He was a WWI hero. 'Lafayette, we are here.' This was Pershing's quote upon arrival in France.

questions.text: James Fenimore Cooper wrote 'Last of the Mohicans'. What region did the Mohicans inhabit?
Which president used his status as a hero in the Mexican War to propel him to the White House?
questions.explanation:
Zachary Taylor.

	A successful general is halfway there.

questions.text: Which event occurred EARLIEST in time?
options: Custer's defeat at Little Big Horn
The Purchase of Alaska by the US
questions.explanation:
The Civil War.

	The other events were 1867-1881. (The Civil War was 1861-1865).

questions.text: Lindbergh became an instant hero when he crossed the Atlantic. He departed from New York; where did he land?
Which judge handed down the Dred Scott Decision?
questions.explanation:
Roger Taney.

	Pre-Civil War and a sad decision for all African-Americans enslaved and free at the time.

questions.text: Everyone knows what happened to the ill-fated Donner party as they went west. Where is Donner Pass?
questions.explanation:
California.

	It's in California, near Nevada.

questions.text: Which was one of the original 13 colonies?
questions.explanation:
Maryland.

	The Midwest areas came later.
